definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: Don't cry, you know, no one will help you to wipe tears.
sentences.chinese: 不要流淚了，你要知道，沒有人會幫你擦眼淚。

sentences.english: Even if accompanied with dreary day let us smile with teats .
sentences.chinese: 即使陰雨作伴讓我們流淚著歡笑。

sentences.english: The smoke made her eyes water.
I weep for the drifting years.
sentences.chinese: 我爲了似水流年而流淚。

sentences.english: And when eyes cry, hands wipe their tears.
sentences.chinese: 而眼睛流淚了，手也會去拭淚。

sentences.english: I now repent with bitter tears, Lord, I'm coming home.
sentences.chinese: 今天懊悔流淚悲切，主，我要回家。

sentences.english: Some time I don't know why I will cry, just letting tears down capriciously.
sentences.chinese: 很多時候不懂得爲何會流淚，只是肆意得任性得流下。

sentences.english: Or I might continue munching popcorn right through my tears.
sentences.chinese: 或者我會一邊爲劇情傷心流淚，一邊卻在喫爆米花。

sentences.english: The sister, accustomed as she was to austerities , felt a tear spring to her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 那個一貫嚴肅的姆姆也覺得要流淚了。

sentences.english: And as she did, she frequently said, "Sorry about the tears."
sentences.chinese: 她邊流淚道再見，邊又頻頻因著淚水而道歉。

sentences.english: I would like weeping with the smile rather than repenting with the cry.
sentences.chinese: 寧願笑着流淚，也不哭着說後悔。

sentences.english: In tears, Sun promised he would dw so.
sentences.chinese: 在流淚，孫答應他會幹重等。

sentences.english: We often shed tear which deceive ourselves after deceive others.
sentences.chinese: 我們常常流淚，這會在欺人之後又復自欺。

sentences.english: Emily wept bitter tears orver her choice.
sentences.chinese: 艾米莉爲她的選擇痛苦的流淚。

sentences.english: As they pass through the Valley of Baca, they make it a place of springs;
sentences.chinese: 他們經過流淚谷，叫這谷變爲泉源之地。

sentences.english: It is allergic that eye acid always weeps acerbitily?
sentences.chinese: 眼睛酸酸的總流淚是過敏嗎？

definition: to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
to leave (on a long journey)/to part from sb
